page.title: 04THE WATER SUPPLY-RIVER SWIFT
page.content: {The River Swift}used to be much deeper than it is now, and was used as the water supply for the village.Most of the houses along the valley still have wells in their gardens, and although some wells have been boarded up, others feature as garden ornaments. There are old photographs of floods in Church Street, and in the 19th century 2 people and a pig were drowned in the river. A pumping station has been built between{Ibthorpe}and{Upton}which pumps water into a covered reservoir on Pill Heath. This supplements the{Andover water supply and reduces the flow of the{River Swift}to below flood level. Many of the valley houses, and the church, had walls as protection against flood water.
